channel.title: An easy question about portals...need help ASAP though :P
channel.description:
Well, yep, another stupid question by Miss_Doctor. Anywho, i'm tired of using NPC's to tele people around the server, so I decided to start using portals. More fashionable. Thinking of a portal centre to tele to all the skill areas. ANYWAY...I've made the objects and eveything, so now I need to make the "case" No idea what to put there, I kinda just guessed and it didn't work, so what do I put under the case of the portal if I just want it to tele you somewhere?
This is what I put....
[code]case 7318: teleportToX = 3255; teleportToY = 3382; break;[/code]
Wrong as usual? (I GUESSED! :()
Edit: What I mean by not working is not about errors on compile or run, but when you click on the portal it just....won't work. :S

item.title: An easy question about portals...need help ASAP though :P
item.dc:creator: @Miss_Doctor Miss_Doctor
item.description:
@Miss_Doctor wrote:

what do you mean…method? I’m sorry, i’m a bit…slow. Rofl. I got to client.java…put in the global object code to put the portal down, and yes, the portal shows up…then I go to where the rest of the cases are and put that little thing at my first post in…o_O

Read full topic

@Miss_Doctor wrote:

If you’re still here pat…I have anoter question, not really so serious, just wondering…I have a fishing spot, I want it to make you fish shrimps with the requirement of having a net and 0 fishing lvl. So far I have it so that you have to use the net with the fishing spot…that’s the only way I can get it. There’s something wrong with my cases. Lol.

item.dc:creator: @Miss_Doctor Miss_Doctor
item.description:
@Miss_Doctor wrote:

where the do this and do that phrases are, do I put the tele coords?

I wish I could use this with another portal, only prob is my server doesnt have any.

item.source: An easy question about portals...need help ASAP though :P

item.title: An easy question about portals...need help ASAP though :P
item.dc:creator: @PatScape PatScape
item.description:
@PatScape wrote:

well there’s a way to reuse a case so you can have the same portal ID in different places, teleport to different areas. Here’s what i mean:

case 2465: if (objectX == Xcoords && objectY == Ycoords) { do this; } if (objectX == Xcoords && objectY == Ycoords) { do that; } break;

do you have msn? add me if so, kamakazaiwatermelon@hotmail.com

also, make sure your case is somewhere under

switch(objectID) {

and not somewhere else.

Read full topic
item.source: An easy question about portals...need help ASAP though :P

item.title: An easy question about portals...need help ASAP though :P
item.dc:creator: @Miss_Doctor Miss_Doctor
item.description:
@Miss_Doctor wrote:

Really? I put in the height lvl as 0 (yeah that pointless code) and it didnt make a difference. Guess you don’t need it. And no, there arent duplicate cases…could’ve sworn if that was the case I would get errors…and i’m not. I guess i’ll try the 4389 and 4390s, the only problem with that then (if they work) is that I need ALOT more than just 2 portals. -sigh- Ah well. Thanks for your help anyway :)[br][size=1]Posted on: October 13, 2007, 06:04:46 PM[/size][hr]Ok…I tried those…didn’t work. This is making me unbelievably pissed.

Read full topic
item.source: An easy question about portals...need help ASAP though :P

item.title: An easy question about portals...need help ASAP though :P
item.dc:creator: @PatScape PatScape
item.description:
@PatScape wrote:

Well, honestly, that’s not a stupid question… look around at people saying ‘omg help plz wats clien.javere??’ n’ shit.

On topic, is the portal’s item ID 7318?
is there a duplicate case?
I have used 4389 and 4390 for my cases (and of course portal ID’s with no problems. It could be a glitch in the actual portal because your code is perfect. Sorry, that’s about I can say to help.

Read full topic
